definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: To not follow the truly humane will bring immeasurable harm.
sentences.chinese: 要是不亲热有仁德的人，那将带给咱们如许大的坏处。

sentences.english: Amanda: You made out with a girl from a sleepover?
sentences.chinese: 你和一个夜宿的女孩亲热了？

sentences.english: The young father puckered up his lips and gave the baby a fond kiss.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的爸爸噘起嘴唇，亲热地吻了一下婴儿。

sentences.english: My uncle is never lavish of endearments.
sentences.chinese: 我舅舅从不过分表示亲热。

sentences.english: In fact, relationships between mortals invariably include conflict as well as canoodling.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，两性关系总是包括冲突和亲热爱抚。

sentences.english: Molly is necking with Ted and thinking of Ken.
sentences.chinese: 莫莉和泰德亲热的时候还想着肯。

sentences.english: He received me very affectionately, for he always lov'd me.
sentences.chinese: 他很亲热地接待了我，因为他一直爱我。

sentences.english: One sweet Chinese girl, who is good-looking , turned sexual contact with her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 该校一名相貌甜美的华裔女生跟男友亲热性接触。

sentences.english: I avoided them as fas as possible when they were necking.
sentences.chinese: 在他们亲热时，我尽可能地避开他们。

sentences.english: Her aunt is making over the baby again.
sentences.chinese: 她的姑母又在与那个婴儿亲热起来了。

sentences.english: He accosted me with excessive warmth, for he had been drinking much.
sentences.chinese: 他亲热的招呼我，因为他肚里灌饱了酒。

sentences.english: They were really sexing it up last night.
sentences.chinese: 他们昨夜亲热得难舍难分。

sentences.english: In chapter 6, you will discover how men and women have different needs for intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 第六章你会发现男人和女人对亲热有何不同要求。

sentences.english: But James, too, isn't very affectionate.
sentences.chinese: 但是James也很少有身体亲热接触。

sentences.english: When Eric and Yeung Sau Wai exchanged their rings, they had a sweet and happy couple's fight.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威与杨秀惠交换戒指打情骂俏，相当亲热。

sentences.english: "Why, hello, Charles, " he called affably; "back again?"
sentences.chinese: 喂，你好啊，查理，“他亲热地喊道，”回来了？

definition: to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
